channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: Simmering US-China tensions unsettle markets, $A drops

item.description: Adrian Morley, who left the NRL after six seasons in 2007, understands why Greg Inglis wants to play again and has backed him to succeed at his former club.
item.title: 'It's a great coup': Morley backs Inglis to shine in Super League

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: More than 160,000 COVID-19 tests conducted as state rejects calls to reopen borders

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australian states and territories at odds over border reopenings as global COVID-19 cases hit 5 million, nation's death toll stands at 100

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Five people were in the sedan when it hit a tree and burst into flames south of Chinchilla, police say.
item.title: Three dead after fiery Western Downs crash

item.description: ESPN will air a nine-part documentary series next year focusing on former New England Patriot Tom Brady's record nine Super Bowl appearances.
item.title: Brady gets 'The Last Dance' treatment as ESPN unveils nine-part series

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Trump says G7 may be held in person because the US has 'done well'; global virus cases top 5 million

item.description: Models suggest that, under some scenarios, half of Yemen's population of 30 million could be infected with the virus and more than 40,000 could die.
item.title: Iran says 10,000 medics infected as virus fears rise in Mideast

item.description: World No.6 Stefanos Tsitsipas believes one silver lining of the coronavirus pandemic has been a chance for the planet to take a breather.
item.title: 'Good for nature': Tsitsipas says lockdown should be annual fixture

item.description: Jerome Powell says the path to economic recovery for the US remains unclear as job layoffs related to the coronavirus hit nearly 39 million in two months.
item.title: 'A downturn without modern precedent': Fed chair paints a grim economic picture

item.description: As of Thursday morning, the US the national coronavirus death toll was about 93,000, and was still increasing.
item.title: Democrats want flags at half-staff when coronavirus toll reaches 100,000

item.description: The environment for Chinese companies in the US was already hostile, now the rapid downfall of China's Luckin Coffee for accounting fraud has escalated tensions.
item.title: Coffee startup's downfall escalates China Inc's Wall Street issues

item.description: A fresh wave of China-US tensions that raised doubts about the trade deal reached early this year between the world's two largest economies.
item.title: Wall Street finishes lower on US-China tensions

item.description: The storm's path did not bring it directly over one of the world's most vulnerable refugee populations in Bangladesh.
item.title: Cyclone Amphan death toll jumps in India and Bangladesh

item.description: China says Canada must free Huawei Technologies chief financial officer Meng Wanzhou, who is fighting extradition to the United States.
item.title: China doesn't get Canada's judiciary: PM Justin Trudeau

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: NSW Police Assistant Commissioner Peter Thurtell said he was "very grateful" nobody had been killed.
item.title: Car ploughs into Greenacre shop, 14 taken to hospital

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Australian researchers have found ways to improve the durability of new solar technology that could one day rival or complement traditional silicon cells, bringing its mass production a step closer to reality.
item.title: Australian scientists 'drastically improve' new solar cell technology

item.description: The US has announced its intention to withdraw from the 35-nation Open Skies treaty allowing unarmed surveillance flights over member countries.
item.title: US pulls out of Open Skies treaty, Trump's latest treaty withdrawal

item.description: Recent warnings about a puzzling inflammatory syndrome linked to COVID-19 have focused on children. But some US doctors say they are seeing the illness in young adults too.
item.title: Young adults are also affected by Kawasaki-like disease linked to coronavirus, US doctors say

item.description: While the government is backing coal, Australia is probably the best-placed country in the world to tap into the switch to renewable energy in coming decades.
item.title: In post-pandemic renewables boom, Australia is once again the lucky country

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: China is set to impose new national security legislation on Hong Kong, provoking fears of further protests as China recovers from the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: China to impose sweeping national security law in Hong Kong

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: The Full House actor and her husband have agreed to serve two months and five months in prison, respectively, under plea agreements filed in court.
item.title: Lori Loughlin, husband to plead guilty to US college admissions scam

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: The donors include billionaire philanthropist Kerr Neilson who said he was "interested in ensuring the country has as much exposure to 'art' as is practicable".
item.title: Philanthropists offer multimillion-dollar lifeline to Carriageworks

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: Survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault and child abuse will be forced to assemble their own evidence of harm suffered under proposed changes to victims' compensation claims, prompting fears many will relive their trauma as a result.
item.title: 'Many people will just give up': Crime victims forced to gather own evidence under reform

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Local councils will be promised $1.8 billion in federal funds to accelerate projects that support jobs during the coronavirus crisis.
item.title: Local councils to get $1.8 billion to spend on infrastructure

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: An Australian-first study has found very low transmission of COVID-19 in children, which researchers say should give parents confidence to send their children back to school.
item.title: Australia-first study finds low transmission of COVID-19 in children

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Turn on your webcam, enable your microphone and share your computer screen, an anonymous voice told Emily Johnston as she sat her first online exam.
item.title: 'You’re being watched and recorded, every breath': Students unsettled by exam software

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Authorities are playing a waiting game with a 33-bed hospital in a Sydney jail.
item.title: The people keeping COVID-19 out of prison

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: A surge in class-action lawsuits has triggered a crackdown on companies that fund litigation in the pursuit of massive financial settlements, forcing the sector to submit to tougher federal law.
item.title: New rules for litigation funders after jump in class actions

item.description: We need gas in the interim, but it is polluting and costly - and we need be careful we don't invest billions in assets that will become stranded.
item.title: Let's talk about gas - a great resource of diminishing value

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Patient advocates and doctors are urging governments to devise a plan to catch up on elective surgery after the coronavirus shutdown.
item.title: Government 'needs a plan to catch up' on elective surgery as wait lists balloon

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: NSW government agency icare will release new guidelines for employers on Friday to prepare them for an increase in mental health problems among employees.
item.title: Employers prepare for return of mentally fragile workforce

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The true scope of attempted attacks on health data may never be known.
item.title: 'Sweep it under the carpet': Health tech cyber threats loom

item.description: The road to combating climate change is frustratingly slow and convoluted. And even the latest road map doesn't seem to have the answers.
item.title: Coalition's climate road map leads nation up a dead end

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Friday, May 22

item.description: Do we rise through workplace hierarchies to a level of incompetence?
item.title: Peter Principle still evident in workplaces

item.description: There has been an explosion of interest in community singing in Australia over the past 10 years, but COVID-19 presents particulars risk for choirs.
item.title: Choirs confronting COVID tragedies find their virtual voice

item.description: After dreaming about a career in journalism, Mary Doolan became a solicitor before discovering a passion in teaching.
item.title: Teaching trumps journalism and legal career aspirations

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: Live music may be on hiatus but these artists are ensuring the soundtrack to our quarantined lives can continue.
item.title: Top five new Aussie songs to listen to this week

item.dc:creator: Harry Hollinsworth
item.description: Yesterday’s vote gave a victory to both Advance Australia Fair and the opinion polls which have predicted its win all along.
item.title: In the Herald: May 22, 1977

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: The gyrations of Australia's tech stocks over recent months has hidden a remarkable comeback by one of its former darlings, last mile logistics provider Getswift.
item.title: Former AFL player's Getswift makes comeback with revenue boost

item.dc:creator: Melissa Singer
item.description: Since COVID-19, people have developed an obsession with good hygiene. And there are plenty of sensible guidelines for how often people should launder their clothes, bedding and towels.
item.title: How often to wash your clothes, bedding and towels

item.dc:creator: Kathryn Wicks
item.description: On May 22, 1990, future Sydney Swans coach John Longmire starred in an upset win against Victoria in a landmark State of Origin match.
item.title: From the Archives, 1990: Longmire NSW hero as underdogs reign in rain

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: A unique opportunity has been made possible through a job-sharing arrangement.
item.title: Online curators share job of enriching curriculum

item.description: How to safeguard your wellbeing when your home has become your place of work.
item.title: There are many mental health challenges in working from home

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Friday, May 22

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: As this column reported, Federal Circuit Court Judge Christopher Kendall found the “sheer extent of copying” by Jason Pennell was “unacceptable”.
item.title: Repercussions? None, despite $329,000 a year pay

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: Catholic bishops have been asked to cede more control of the church to lay people.
item.title: Secret bishops' report calls for radical revamp of Catholic Church

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 22, 2020
